title: Method B — Fall of potential method
fullText:
The resistance to ground of the installation earth electrode shall be tested using the "fall of potential method".
Figure 4.30 shows the fall of potential method of testing the electrode, using a proprietary meter.
NOTE IEC 61557‑5 specifies that the meter is required to have a maximum output voltage of 50 V and a maximum current of 3.5 mA.
The approximate value obtained by the use of a proprietary meter is typically in the order of 50 Ω to 200 Ω in good soil conditions.
WARNING: EXTREME CARE IS NEEDED TO ENSURE THAT THIS TEST CAN BE AND IS CARRIED OUT
